entry.title: Will Machines surpass human intelligence?
entry.content:
The below Ted-Talk is an excellent starting point for understanding why it is important for everyone to come to grips with the advances currently being made in Artificial Intelligence.

The video mainly focuses on the development of the “singularity”, which is the point where computers become more intelligent than mankind. This sort of artificial intelligence is often referred to as “General Artificial Intelligence”, as opposed to the term “narrow artificial intelligence”.

The difference lies in the ability of computer systems to apply intelligence generally across a broad domain of problems as opposed to being confined to a narrowly defined set of problems. For example, a narrow artificial intelligence system used to diagnose breast cancer from x-ray images would be useless for identifying broken bones, whilst a more generally intelligent system might be able to transfer a more general knowledge of how to read x-rays across a number of different radiology tasks.

The “Singularity” is considered to be the ultimate goal in the development of general artificial intelligence, with the ability to learn and solve any number of problems or tasks across any domain of knowledge better than humans. It is important to note, however, that a multitude of narrow AI applications applied across various human activities using present-day technology could have the same impact upon society as the hypothetical “singularity”.
